means: 开玩笑( joke的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Ray was very giggly and joking all the time.
sentence.Network_cn: 蕾特别喜欢咯咯地笑，而且总是爱开玩笑。

sentence.Network_en: Neil's colleagues say he was actually in a joking, upbeat mood.
sentence.Network_cn: 内尔的同事们说他实际上在说笑逗乐，心情不错。
你准是在开玩笑。你是认真的吗？

PerfectNetExp.abs: 《Friends》词汇表A ... collected adj. 收集成的, 冷静的, 镇定的 joking adj. 戏谑的, 开玩笑的 organisms n. 生物体, 有机体.

list.abs: ...m), 英文考试 (English Exam), 英文笑话 (English Joke)

除了蓝绿;... ... 14. out of the clear blue sky: 晴天霹雳 15. blue joke: 成人笑话 16. in the red: 亏损；不赚钱.

entry.def: A joke is something that is said or done to make you laugh, for example a funny story.

example.ex: He debated whether to make a joke about shooting rabbits, but decided against it...
example.tran: 他心里琢磨是否该开个有关打兔子的玩笑，但决定还是算了。

example.ex: No one told worse jokes than Claus.
example.tran: 克劳斯讲的笑话糟糕透了。

entry.def: If you joke, you tell funny stories or say amusing things.

example.ex: She would joke about her appearance...
example.tran: 她会拿自己的长相开玩笑。

example.ex: Lorna was laughing and joking with Trevor...
example.tran: 洛娜边笑边和特雷弗打趣。

entry.def: A joke is something untrue that you tell another person in order to amuse yourself.

example.ex: It was probably just a joke to them, but it wasn't funny to me.
example.tran: 对他们而言，那可能仅仅是个恶作剧，但对我来说，它一点也不好笑。

entry.def: If you joke, you tell someone something that is not true in order to amuse yourself.

example.ex: Don't get defensive, Charlie. I was only joking...
example.tran: 别这么大戒心，查理。我只不过是开开玩笑。

example.ex: 'I wish you made as much fuss of me,' Vera joked.
example.tran: “我倒真希望你也能这么好好地关心我一下，”薇拉打趣道。

entry.tran: 荒唐可笑的事（或人）；笑料；笑柄
entry.def: If you say that something or someone is a joke, you think they are ridiculous and do not deserve respect.

example.ex: It's ridiculous, it's pathetic, it's a joke...
example.tran: 这真荒谬，简直是可悲、可笑。

example.ex: The police investigation was a joke. A total cover-up.
example.tran: 警方的调查简直荒唐可笑，完全是在掩盖真相。

entry.tran: （恼人或令人担心的事）不可理喻，使人无法接受
entry.def: If you say that an annoying or worrying situation is beyond a joke, you are emphasizing that it is worse than you think is fair or reasonable.

example.ex: Giving an arsonist a lighter is beyond a joke...
example.tran: 把打火机交给纵火犯简直是不可理喻。

example.ex: I'm not afraid of a fair fight but this is beginning to get beyond a joke.
example.tran: “我不怕公平地打上一架，但是这玩笑有点儿开过头了。”

entry.tran: 拿（严肃或悲惨的事情）开玩笑；对…一笑置之
entry.def: If you make a joke of something, you laugh at it even though it is in fact rather serious or sad.

example.ex: I wish I had your courage, Michael, to make a joke of it like that.
example.tran: 我真希望能有你那样的勇气，迈克尔，能把事情那么一笑置之。

entry.tran: 不是轻而易举的事；不是闹着玩的
entry.def: If you describe a situation as no joke, you are emphasizing that it is very difficult or unpleasant.

example.ex: Two hours on a bus is no joke, is it?
example.tran: 在公交车上坐上两个小时可不轻松，对吧？

entry.def: If you say that the joke is on a particular person, you mean that they have been made to look very foolish by something.

example.ex: 'For once,' he said, 'the joke's on me. And it's not very funny.'
example.tran: “他说：“这一次玩笑反而开到自己身上来了。这一点儿也不好玩。”

entry.tran: 开不起玩笑；经不起玩笑话
entry.def: If you say that someone cannot take a joke, you are criticizing them for getting upset or angry at something you think is funny.

example.ex: 'What's the matter with you, Simon?' Curly said. 'Can't  you take a joke?'
example.tran: “西蒙，你怎么回事？”柯利说。“你难道开不起玩笑么？”

entry.tran: （用于表示吃惊或认为不可理喻）你一定是在开玩笑吧
entry.def: You say you're  joking or you must be joking to someone when they have just told you something that is so surprising or unreasonable that you find it difficult to believe.

example.tran: 你准是在开玩笑。你是认真的吗？

example.ex: One hundred and forty quid for a pair of headphones, you've got to be joking!
example.tran: 一副耳机140英镑，你不是在开玩笑吧！

means.word_mean: 1. characterized by jokes and good humor

auth_sentence.content: Of course, Wittgenstein might simply have been joking.
auth_sentence.res_content: Of course, Wittgenstein might simply have been joking.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Of course, Wittgenstein might simply have been joking.

auth_sentence.content: He liked laughing with people, he liked joking.
auth_sentence.res_content: He liked laughing with people, he liked joking.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He liked laughing with people, he liked joking.

auth_sentence.content: The former Liverpool manager was joking to a point.
auth_sentence.res_content: The former Liverpool manager was joking to a point.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The former Liverpool manager was joking to a point.

sentences.en: Don’t be upset;I was only joking.
sentences.cn: 不要生气,我只是开玩笑的。

sentences.en: From the twinkle in her eyes we know she is joking.
sentences.cn: 我们从她闪烁的眼神知道她在开玩笑。

sentences.en: No, but joking apart, do you think we should go and see if she’s OK?
sentences.cn: 不，言归正传，我们是不是应该去看看她是不是还好？

sentences.en: ‘It’s the best film I’ve ever seen.’ ‘You must be joking!’
sentences.cn: “这是我看过的最好的电影了。”“你别开玩笑了！”

sentences.en: ‘The boss wants us to work late again.’ ‘What? You’re joking!’
sentences.cn: “老板又让我们加班了。”“什么？别开玩笑了！”
